STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 26, 2024
Matthew Yohe
BARAGA/HOUGHTON/KEWEENAW COUNTY DHHS
108 MAIN ST,
BARAGA, MI, 49908-9671
RE: License#: CP070200958
Dear Mr. Yohe:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
06/25/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM 722-06H Case Contacts
Quality visits between the case manager and child
have been found to produce positive outcomes for
children in care. A quality visit is defined as one in
which the case manager: • Views the child's
bedroom and sleeping arrangements. • Verifies
safe sleep environments and practices for infants
under 12 months.
One of three foster care files did not document safe sleep during in home visits
for April and May 2024.
Fom 801-03 Medical Passports
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child's current and complete health
information.
One of three foster care files did not document updated medical passports for the
third and fourth quarters of 2023.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incidents reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of CAPS. The agency was informed that starting January 1,
2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be reviewed with the agency at
three months and six months. The assigned Consultant for the agency will
work with the agency in conducting CAP reviews. This process for special
investigation CAP reviews was implemented previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows:
The agency submitted a corrective action plan on 07/28/23 in response to a policy
violation established during the 07/06/23, Interim Inspection. The current renewal
inspection did not establish a repeat violation of the policy indicating the agency
CAP was successful in preventing a repeat violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The report indicated there
was significant worker turnover during the licensing year including a supervisor
and four foster care worker changes. Additional barriers included parents
cancelling parenting time as well as not meeting with the agency for PATP
involvement. The assessment also addressed positive progress in maintaining rule
and policy compliance.

Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported liking their job and working for the agency. Staff stated
that they feel supported by their supervisor and agency administration is
knowledgeable. Staff reported that the foster care team is supportive of one
another and works well together.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in Baraga and is a modern well maintained facility. CHRI
documents were secured appropriately, and a cross shredder was observed.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1. The home did not have a smoke alarm between the master bedroom
and the rest of the home. In addition, there was not a smoke alarm between the
basement bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Smoke alarms were installed between upper and lower bedrooms and
the rest of the home. Photos were provided of each smoke alarm.
Safety Alert #2. The home was without a carbon monoxide detector and no smoke
alarm between the downstairs bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: A carbon monoxide detector was installed as well as a smoke alarm
between the downstairs bedroom and the rest of the home. Photos of the installed
detectors were provided.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
June 26, 2024
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
